post.author: Sung-Yun Jung
post.content:
Hello,

I am considering immigration and looking for information about IT jobs.
I did some ERP implementation project in Accenture and my skill set includes SAP R/3 MM and PM.  I also have experiences in IT Strategy, and pure strategy work like industry analysis.

I would like to know how I can develop my career in Canada.  Are there many jobs available that suits me?  How is ERP market in Canada?
I am afraid that I could not use ERP skills due to language barrier.

I would appreciate if you reply to me with any job information.

Regards,
Sung-Yun Jung
syjung@popsmail.com

>Hello Every one,
>
>I  went to that Brass Ring's recent Job Fair on June 18th and 19th
>at Toronto Convention Center
>
>There wasn't that much of participants from recruiter side even though
>you had quite a number of job seekers.  
>
>After Internet bubble burst,  the paradigm in IT might have been changed.
>Most recruiters are from manufacturing or financial related.
>
>I apolosize my mistyping ^.^ I can not help but to mis-type. ^.^;
>
>Anyway,   communication skill might be considered more important in recent
>job search because financial and brick and motar compnaies usually want somebody
>with industry knowledge-domain knowledge.
>
>For the skill set, they need C, C++ and UNIX more than ever. This is quite a paradigm
>shift.  Mission-Critical enterprise application and system development expereince is
>also valued (ERP, H/A, SAN and that type of thing)
>
>Anyway, even for those system administors, specific package experience (such as SAP)
>seems to be valued by employers.
>
>Is there anybody who happened to have SAP or Oracle Financial related project
>expereice? We might form a stduy group because getting SAP or Oracle app.
>project experience is die-hard to get regardless of places.
>
>Even in Korea(I had 1 year contract in Korea upuntil alst month), SAP or Oracle App.
>project has been sustained, postphoned and canceled for last three years. This lack is
>causing a lot of trouble in Korea like no Korean ERP consultant.
>
>Anybody with enough of industry specific work process and BPR knowledge can be
>trained as SAP or Oracle App. consultant.  I have very large collection of SAP ERP
>books on consulting, BPR, pjt, implementation and etc.  
>
>I even have ISP(IT Strategic Planning )consulting project with HP consulting Korea,
>AT Kearny Korea and Gap Gemini Earnst and Young Korea.
>
>If interested, please contact me at cosmos@visto.com  
>
>Thank yu,
>
>Jay S. Ha
